channel.title: RS2 Loader
channel.description:
http://rapidshare.com/files/277895233/rs2loader.rar
this is what i use for the base of my projects, any tips on detection methods if i have missed any? the only one i can think of is the advert loading on F2P
give me thoughts and opinions on the actual code too.
ta

item.title: RS2 Loader
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:12, topic:301286”]cool thanks, does anyone have any light on the advert loading for F2P?
as they have access to it as it is visible or not depending on if your character is a member. the adverts have an “id” which i assume they can check and probably will do[/quote]

Well you have the netscape package that is used for accessing things like that right? Check if they do it and return what they want.

Read full topic

item.title: RS2 Loader
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

cool thanks, does anyone have any light on the advert loading for F2P?
as they have access to it as it is visible or not depending on if your character is a member. the adverts have an “id” which i assume they can check and probably will do

Read full topic

item.title: RS2 Loader
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

There is nothing wrong with loading the client in a program that makes the client think it is a browser. A quick scan of this seems to do just that, the only thing I would change is the firefox 1.5 useragent, I doubt many use that anymore.

Read full topic

item.title: RS2 Loader
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

Why need an instance of the loader? Everything you need to get started with is static afaik (reference from the client class, not the loader class)

EDIT:
Like grab a Class instance of the client class then get fields from that.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 12, 2009, 06:38:47 pm[/size][hr]An issue I see is with communicating from a slave to the master (the slave being what actually interacts with the applet, the master being an interface to the slaves)… RMI can become very wasteful seeing as all objects passed back and forth must be serialized… damn IPC. I guess you could use the one-applet botting solution but that’s kind of, eh, cheap[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 12, 2009, 06:39:18 pm[/size][hr]Note a similar issue is also what made me stop working on SCARSI!

Read full topic

item.title: RS2 Loader
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

oksuper_:

Not if they don’t suck.

the problem i have is always getting the instance of the loader, currently i edit java.applet.Applet and make it store all loaded applets in a static hashtable and then look for a “loader” applet, though this is tedious and ugly.

do you have any advice?

Read full topic

item.title: RS2 Loader
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

Not if they don’t suck.

Read full topic

item.title: RS2 Loader
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

oksuper_:

I mean… why do you load the jar in your own frame? Let your browser load it up… what I’m getting at is that bots that use ‘loaders’ such as this are stupid and agent bots are ez and less potentially detectable.

but they become very ugly very fast

Read full topic

item.title: RS2 Loader
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

I mean… why do you load the jar in your own frame? Let your browser load it up… what I’m getting at is that bots that use ‘loaders’ such as this are stupid and agent bots are ez and less potentially detectable.

Read full topic

item.title: RS2 Loader
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

oksuper_:

Sorry, I mean why do you use a local loader for the client. That is stupid, why use that method of doing things when people have discovered so much better?

what do you mean by a local loader? i load it off their website after parsing jar names and prefix’s

i.e. http://world2.runescape.com/loader-345832539.jar

Read full topic

item.title: RS2 Loader
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

Sorry, I mean why do you use a local loader for the client. That is stupid, why use that method of doing things when people have discovered so much better?

Read full topic

item.title: RS2 Loader
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

oksuper_:

Why not use Jagex’s… custom loaders r for gays.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 10, 2009, 12:29:31 am[/size][hr]BTW, I’d say it’s highly undetectable to use JEditorPane, which loads all resources without you having to any hard work.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 10, 2009, 12:30:45 am[/size][hr]JarHandler is frank_'s, isn’t it?

i do use jagex loader,
is there a problem with the way i currently load web-pages?
and yes it is

Read full topic

item.title: RS2 Loader
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

Why not use Jagex’s… custom loaders r for gays.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 10, 2009, 12:29:31 am[/size][hr]BTW, I’d say it’s highly undetectable to use JEditorPane, which loads all resources without you having to any hard work.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 10, 2009, 12:30:45 am[/size][hr]JarHandler is frank_'s, isn’t it?
